cap.senderName: Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Erica, Rawson, Walhalla and surrounds.

  • There is a bushfire at Knotts Siding Road Rawson.
  • The bushfire is burning within State Forest.
  • CFA and FFMV firefighters are working together to suppress the fire.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The road into Walhalla from the intersection of Tyers Walhalla Road is closed. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

The next update is expected by 02/10/2023 09:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

- There is a bushfire at Knotts Siding Road Rawson.
- The bushfire is burning within State Forest.
- CFA and FFMV firefighters are working together to suppress the fire.


There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Cobbannah, Glenaladale, Moornapa. 

  • It is strongly recommended you Prepare to Evacuate. 
  • There is a bushfire at Duffy Rd, Briagolong that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling in a north-easterly direction due to a south-westerly wind. 
  • If you are camping in the area, evacuate immediately. 
  • There are numerous fires in the area. 
  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7:06 pm.
  • If you choose to stay, emergency services may not be able to help you. 
If you are located in this area, act now to protect your life. Prepare to evacuate immediately and leave as soon as you are ready, as roads will become busy as people leave.
What you should do: 
How to evacuate: 
You should pack: 
  • Cash 
  • Clothing for three days 
  • Medicine for three days 
  • Phone and chargers 
  • Toiletries 
  • Important documents 
  • Momentos and photos 
  • Pet essentials, including leash and carriers. 
  • If possible, make sure your neighbours are aware of the situation and check if they need help. 
  • Check the VicRoads website for road closures.   

When you are ready, you should leave immediately. Donâ€™t wait to be told when to leave. 

Where to go: 
  • You can go to friends or family in a safer location.  
  • Residents in the warning area should leave by travelling south towards Sale.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following roads are closed:
  • Dargo Road between Freestone Creek Road and Wallers Road
  • Harrietville Road
  • Freestone Creek Road intersection of Valencia Creek Road
  • Valencia Creel Road intersection of Marathon Road
  • Bairnsdale - Dargo Road, intersection of Fernbank Glenaladale Road
  • Beverleys Road, intersection of Munro-Stockdale Road
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 02/10/2023 09:00 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is for Loch Sport.

  • There is a fire at Loch Sport that is not yet under control.
  • FFMVic and CFA firefighters are working to suppress the fire.  
  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 3:50pm. 
Don't wait - If you are not prepared to stay, leaving now is the safest option. Conditions may change and get worse very quickly. Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do:

The best protection from radiant heat and smoke is distance.

Travel to:
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • When you leave, remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
  • If you encounter smoke or flames while travelling, turn around and drive to safety. If you're unable to turn around and drive to safety, a car offers more protection from the fire's heat than being caught on foot in the open.
  • If you are away from home, do not return.

In the car:
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety. 
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you choose to stay, seek shelter indoors: 
  • Bring your pets indoors.
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents.
  • Turn off cooling systems.
  • Shelter in a room that has a door and a window to the outside so you can keep an eye on what is happening with the fire.
Impacts in your area:
  • Roads on public land are closed.
  • Longford-Loch Sport Road is open to local traffic only. 
  • At this stage, the fire is unlikely to impact the community, please continue to monitor warnings. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 02/10/2023 08:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Dargo, Crooked River and surrounds and surrounding areas.

  • There is a bushfire at Duffy Rd, Briagolong that is not yet under control.
  • The fire is impacting Bairnsdale-Dargo Road and it is not safe to travel south of Waterford.
  • Your safest option is to take shelter in Dargo township.
  • Fire crews will assess the situation this evening or tomorrow morning and determine if it is safe to travel along the Dargo Bairnsdale Road south of Waterford.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Bairnsdale-Dargo Road is closed at the  Fernbank Glenaladale Road intersection.
  •  Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 02/10/2023 08:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Brumby.

  • There is a bushfire 20km West Of Wulgulmerang, Brumby.
  • Firefighters have managed to stop the spread of the fire and will continue to monitor the area.
  • The bushfire started near Forlorn Hope Track within the Alpine National Park.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 9:56am on Saturday 30 September.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are patrolling this fire.
  • Aircraft are operating in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 02/10/2023 12:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Briagolong, Cobbannah, Culloden, Moornapa and surrounds. 

  • It is strongly recommended you Prepare to Evacuate. 
  • There is a bushfire at Duffy Rd, Briagolong that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling in a north-easterly direction due to a south-westerly wind. 
  • If you are camping in the area, evacuate immediately. 
  • There are numerous fires in the area. 
  • This Watch and Act replaces the Emergency Warning issued at 7:14pm.
If you are located in the Briagolong area, act now to protect your life. Prepare to evacuate immediately and leave as soon as you are ready, as roads will become busy as people leave.
What you should do: 
How to evacuate: 
You should pack: 
  • Cash 
  • Clothing for three days 
  • Medicine for three days 
  • Phone and chargers 
  • Toiletries 
  • Important documents 
  • Momentos and photos 
  • Pet essentials, including leash and carriers. 
  • If possible, make sure your neighbours are aware of the situation and check if they need help. 
  • Check the VicRoads website for road closures.   

When you are ready, you should leave immediately. Donâ€™t wait to be told when to leave. 

Where to go: 
  • You can go to friends or family in a safer location.  
Residents in the warning area should leave by travelling south towards Sale via Briagolong.

Impacts in your area: 

  • The following roads are closed:
  • Dargo Road between Freestone Creek Road and Wallers Road
  • Harrietville Road
  • Freestone Creek Road intersection of Valencia Creek Road
  • Valencia Creel Road intersection of Marathon Road
  • Bairnsdale - Dargo Road, at Fernbank Glenaladale Road
  • Beverleys Road, intersection of Munro-Stockdale Road
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 02/10/2023 09:00 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
